title: Study help
content:
Sorry that I am asking this question again 
But can someone give a roadmap of all subjects to do so that I feel confident attending isa1

comments.body: Are you in physics or chemistry cycle
honestly for everything slides are more than enough.. for math make sure you do the classwork problems as questions came from there for us

Math- practice classwork questions. When you're thorough with those, move on to assignments/qb. You need to be quick at solving because they always make the paper long and many people struggle to finish it.

Python- 4 markers will generally be writing codes. Read slides and notes for theory.

Chem- everything comes directly fron slides. Just read those and go. You'll definitely get at least 2 numerical problems.

Mechanics- 4 markers come copy pasted from the textbook. They don't even change values. Mcqs is fully theory.

Epd- I don't remember sorryðŸ’€. Everything was from slides only i think.

Epd they have not given us slides 
Wt to do 
And for mech 
Do I need to solve every q from the tb

>Epd they have not given us slides

Classic pes

>mech Do I need to solve every q from the tb

No. I think you can do the ones that are in the slides (if they've given any). But if you want just look at the textbook and solve the questions that look easy. They usually ask easy numericals in isa and the harder ones in esa.
Wt can I do for epd
Read your class notes. Apparently theyâ€™re more than enough
Can you help me with phy cycle?ðŸ«
i dont remember the name. you can ask in your whatsapp groups.

mechanical-mug up everything from slides. numericals will come.

  
electrical- classwork problems is enough

  
physics-read faisal sir's slides. learn all the formulas for numericals and try to understand concepts because they often ask conceputal questions in theory
I'm not a sir but you're welcome ðŸ˜‚

4th year here - my year had a lot of help by doing a seniors ppt and notes and exam papers.

here is the link we used -https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&opi=89978449&url=https://vibhamasti.github.io/notes.html&ved=2ahUKEwjd29jo9MKJAxV\_yzgGHagpI78QFnoECAoQAQ&sqi=2&usg=AOvVaw3qM\_9xs\_I649jpXwpKZhfH
Can you share the link of the groups?
